skill.name: multi-agent-analysis
skill.description: Analyze coordination patterns, handoff mechanisms, and state sharing in multi-agent systems. Use when (1) understanding how agents transfer control, (2) evaluating shared vs isolated state patterns, (3) mapping communication protocols between agents, (4) assessing multi-agent orchestration approaches, or (5) comparing coordination models across frameworks.
skill.summary: Analyze coordination patterns, handoff mechanisms, and state sharing in multi-agent systems. Use whe...
skill.author: Dowwie

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only educational content about multi-agent coordination patterns. No executable code, no file access, no network calls, no environment access, and no external command execution.

content.value_statement: Multi-agent AI systems coordinate through various patterns like supervisor hierarchies, peer networks, and pipelines. This skill helps you map these patterns to understand how agents share state and transfer control between components.
actual_capabilities: Identify coordination models in agent frameworks
limitations: Does not execute or modify agent code
Does not access external files or networks
Does not generate new agent implementations
Requires codebase-mapping skill first to identify agents

use_cases.title: Compare orchestration approaches
use_cases.description: Analyze different frameworks to choose the right coordination model for your application requirements.

use_cases.title: Trace control flow in agents
use_cases.description: Map how control transfers between agents to identify potential security vulnerabilities and attack surfaces.

use_cases.title: Design multi-agent systems
use_cases.description: Use documented patterns to design robust agent coordination that prevents loops and state conflicts.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Framework Analysis
prompt_templates.scenario: Understanding agent coordination in a codebase
prompt_templates.prompt: Use multi-agent-analysis to analyze this codebase. Identify the coordination model, list all agents and their roles, document how handoffs work, classify the state sharing pattern, and describe the communication protocol used.

prompt_templates.title: Compare Two Frameworks
prompt_templates.prompt: Use multi-agent-analysis to compare the multi-agent coordination in framework A versus framework B. Focus on handoff mechanisms, state isolation, and communication overhead.

prompt_templates.title: Security Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a security-focused multi-agent analysis. Identify all control transfer points, check for loop prevention mechanisms, and assess whether state sharing creates isolation boundaries.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the multi-agent-analysis output template to document the complete coordination architecture of this multi-agent system. Include agent inventory, handoff types, state patterns, and communication methods.

output_examples.input: Analyze the multi-agent coordination in this repository
output: Agent Inventory: Supervisor (Router), SearchAgent, CodeAgent, WriterAgent
Handoff Mechanism: Router-based with explicit context transfer
State Sharing: Hybrid - shared config, per-agent private state
Communication Protocol: Queue-based with async processing
Loop Prevention: Max depth limit of 5 handoffs

best_practices: Use the output template to create consistent documentation across all agent frameworks
Combine with codebase-mapping skill to first identify all agent components before analysis
Check loop prevention mechanisms to ensure agents cannot hand off control indefinitely
anti_patterns: Using shared global state for all agent communication creates tight coupling
Lacking explicit handoff mechanisms leads to implicit and hard-to-trace control flow
Not implementing depth limits allows infinite handoff loops that consume resources

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. This is a prompt-based skill that requires an LLM with strong reasoning capabilities.

faq.question: What coordination models does this skill analyze?
faq.answer: Supervisor hierarchy, peer-to-peer, pipeline sequential, and market-based dynamic allocation patterns.

faq.question: Does this skill access any files?
faq.answer: No. This is a pure analysis skill that reads no files. Use codebase-mapping first to identify agent files.

faq.question: Can this skill help design new multi-agent systems?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the documented patterns as templates. Combine with comparative-matrix for architectural decisions.

faq.question: What state sharing patterns are covered?
faq.answer: Blackboard (shared global state), message passing (isolated state), and hybrid approaches combining both.

faq.question: How does this differ from control-loop-extraction?
faq.answer: Multi-agent-analysis focuses on coordination between agents. Control-loop-extraction analyzes the internal reasoning loop of individual agents.
